Info.Description: This is a sample xml for characterizing liver lesion for MRI

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Observation in high risk patient
ChoiceDataElement.Hint: Observation : Area with imaging features that differ from those of adjacent liver parenchyma \r\n high risk patient:in whom the incidence of HCC is sufficient to justify screening or surveillance according to AASLD guidelines

Choice.Label: Treated observation
Choice.Hint: An observation that has undergone loco-regional treatment

Choice.Label: Definitely benign
Choice.Hint: Cyst Hemangioma Vascular anomaly Perfusion alteration Hepatic fat deposition or sparing Hypertrophic pseudomass Confluent fibrosis Focal scar Observation that spontaneously disappears at follow-up

Choice.Label: Probably benign
Choice.Hint: Probable benign entities (examples) Probable: Cyst Hemangioma Vascular anomaly Perfusion alteration Hepatic fat deposition or sparing Hypertrophic pseudomass Confluent fibrosis Focal scar LR-2 cirrhosis associated nodule

Choice.Label: Probable malignancy, not specific for HCC
Choice.Hint: Observation is probably malignant, but imaging features are not specific for HCC

Choice.Label: Tumor in vein
Choice.Hint: Presence of tumor in vein lumen.

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Arterial phase enhancement
ChoiceDataElement.Hint: Enhancement in the arterial phase that is less than that of liver.

NumericDataElement.Label: Diameter (mm)
NumericDataElement.Hint: Size of the lesion (outer edge to outer edge) in mm

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Washout
ChoiceDataElement.Hint: Visually assessed temporal reduction in enhancement relative to liver from an earlier to a later phase resulting in portal venous phase hypoenhancement or delayed phase hypoenhancement.

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Capsule
ChoiceDataElement.Hint: Peripheral rim of smooth hyper-enhancement in the portal venous phase or delayed phase that unequivocally is thicker or more conspicuous than the rims surrounding background nodule.

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Threshold Growth
ChoiceDataElement.Hint: Increase in diameter of a mass compared to its baseline by a minimum of 5 mm AND depending on the time interval between examinations, by the following amounts: less than or equal to 6 months: >50% diameter increase greater than 6 months: >100% diameter increase

MultiChoiceDataElement.Label: Are there Ancillary features favoring malignancy?
MultiChoiceDataElement.Hint: Imaging features that modify likelihood of HCC. In isolation, these features do not permit reliable categorization of observations and hence are considered ancillary.

Choice.Label: Hepatobiliary phase hypointensity
Choice.Hint: Intensity in the hepatobiliary phase that unequivocally is less than that of the surrounding liver

Choice.Label: Transitional phase hypointensity
Choice.Hint: Intensity in the transitional phase that unequivocally is less than that of the surrounding liver

Choice.Label: Mild-moderate T2 hyperintensity
Choice.Hint: Having mildly or moderately higher signal intensity on T2w images than liver.

Choice.Label: Distinctive rim
Choice.Hint: Features that specifically favor HCC as opposed to malignancy in general

Choice.Label: Coronaenhancement
Choice.Hint: Zone or rim of peri-observation enhancement in the late arterial phase or early portal venous phase occurring after rapid dissipation of contrast material from an arterial phase hyperenhancing mass.

Choice.Label: Mosaic architecture
Choice.Hint: Observation that appears to consist of nodules or compartments with differing appearances (enhancement, attenuation, intensity). This term can also be applied to lesions with internal enhancing septations. The nodules, compartments, or septations appear randomly distributed within the observation.

Choice.Label: Nodule-in-nodulearchitecture
Choice.Hint: One or more nodular or nodule-like observations within a larger nodular or nodular-like observation.

Choice.Label: Intra-lesional fat
Choice.Hint: Presence of lipid in higher concentration within a mass than in background reference tissue (e.g. liver).

Choice.Label: Lesional iron sparing
Choice.Hint: Relative paucity of iron in a solid mass compared to that of background reference tissue (e.g. iron-overloaded liver).

Choice.Label: Lesional fat sparing
Choice.Hint: Relative paucity of fat in solid mass compared to that of background reference tissue (e.g. fatty liver).

Choice.Label: Blood products
Choice.Hint: Presence of intra-lesional or peri-lesional hemorrhage in absence of biopsy, trauma or intervention.

Choice.Label: Diameter increase less than threshold growth
Choice.Hint: Unequivocal increase in the diameter of an observation, measured on examinations performed on different dates, which is not attributable to artifact, differences in technique between the two examinations, or measurement error.
Choice.ReportText: Diameter increase less than threshold growth

MultiChoiceDataElement.Label: Are there Ancillary features favoring benignity?
MultiChoiceDataElement.Hint: Imaging features that modify likelihood of HCC. In isolation, these features do not permit reliable categorization of observations and hence are considered ancillary.

Choice.Label: Homogeneous marked T2 hyperintensity
Choice.Hint: Having homogeneous and markedly higher signal intensity than liver at T2w imaging.

Choice.Label: Homogeneous marked T2 or T2* hypointensity
Choice.Hint: Having homogeneous and markedly lower signal intensity than liver at T2 or T2* weighted MR imaging.
Choice.ReportText: Homogeneous marked T2 or T2* hypointensity

Choice.Label: Hepatobiliary phase isointensity
Choice.Hint: Intensity in the hepatobiliary phase that unequivocally is less than that of the surrounding liver

Choice.Label: Undistorted vessels
Choice.Hint: Vessels following their normal course without displacement, deformation, or other alteration

Choice.Label: Parallels blood pool enhancement
Choice.Hint: Temporal enhancement pattern in which enhancement in all phases approximates that of the blood pool.

Choice.Label: Diameter reduction
Choice.Hint: Unequivocal decrease in the diameter of an observation, measured on examinations performed on different dates, which is not attributable to artifact, differences in technique between the two examinations, or measurement error.

Choice.Label: Diameter stability ≥ 2 years
Choice.Hint: No significant change in diameter of an observation, measured on examinations performed on different dates and in the absence of treatment.

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Do you want to adjust category based on ancillary features?

Branch.Label: Probable malignancy, not specific for HCC

SectionIfValueNot.SectionIf: HCC category has been adjusted based on the selected Ancillary features favoring Malignancy
HCC category has been adjusted based on the selected Ancillary features favoring Benignity

ReportTexts.ReportText: [HCC-1] Imaging features diagnostic of a benign entity or definite spontaneous disappearance at follow up.
[HCC-2] Observation with imaging features suggestive but not diagnostic of a benign entity.
[HCC-3] Observation that does not meet unequivocal criteria for other LI-RADS categories.
[HCC-4] Observation with imaging features suggestive but not diagnostic of HCC.
[HCC-5] Observation with imaging features diagnostic of HCC.
[HCC-5V] Presence of tumor in vein lumen.
[HCC-M] Observation with one or more imaging features that favor non-HCC malignancy
[HCC-Treated] An observation that has undergone loco-regional treatment.
[HCC-4/HCC-5] Refers to a cell in the LI-RADS table where observations may be considered LR-4, LR-5us, or LR-5g
